usecase

Class ThermalDataSector

  • java.lang.Object
    • usecase.ThermalDataSector

  • public class ThermalDataSector
extends java.lang.Object
    ThermalDataSector is Singleton pattern that restricts the instantiation of a class to one object that implements Rover module with their temperature detail and creates list Map of temperature chart.
    Author:
    Thermal Group (CS537: California State University, Los Angeles)

    • Debasish Guha: debasish.gt@gmail.com
    • Mahdiye Jamali: mahdiye.jamali@gmail.com
    • Gayatri Devpal: gayatridevpal18@gmail.com
    • Mohammad Yazdani: m.yazdani2010@gmail.com

      • tempChart

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Float> tempChart
        tempChart map holds 1480 temperatures indicating a sol temp in Mars key is minute from 10 to 1480 increments by 10 (ex: 10, 20, 30, ... , 1480) and the value is the temperature

      • getTempDataSector

        public static ThermalDataSector getTempDataSector()
        returns the singleton ThermalDataSector object if it exists. It will create the new object if existing thermalDatasector found null
        Returns:
        ThermalDataSector

      • getModuleMap

        Returns:
        Map
        key: Modules
        value: ModuleBase

      • getModule

        public ModuleBase getModule(Modules mod)
        returns the ModuleBase by given key of the ModuleMap
        Parameters:
        Modules -
        Returns:
        ModuleBase

      • getOutsideTemperature

        public java.lang.String getOutsideTemperature()
        returns outside temperature of Mars by reading the temperature chart from JSON file. JSON Chart contains list of 148 temperatures that is demonstrating the Mars temp changing every 10min.
        Returns:
        JSON format String contains current outside temp of Mars

      • getModTemps

        public java.lang.String getModTemps()
        Iterates through the entry map which contains all the rover modules with their current temperature. It returns JSON formated String which contains the parent key 'list' as JSON array.

        kyes:
        list: holds the array of JSON objects that contains name of the module and its current temp
        name: holds the module name
        temperature: holds the current temperature of a particular module at that moment
        Returns:
        String in JSON format Example: {"list":[{ "name": "SAM", "temperature": "2.0" }, { "name": "MOBILITY1", "temperature": "0.0" } ] }

      • initMap

        private void initMap()
        Creates the tempRange for each available modules that are being fetched from ModuleBase Enum. The tempRange and module name is being added to the modeuleMap. Refer to moduleMap object to get all the modules with their temperature range.

      • setTempRange

        public void setTempRange(Modules mod,
                ModuleBase moduleBase)
        Sets the temp range of each module by reading it from JSON file
        Parameters:
        mod -
        moduleBase -

      • setModuleMap

        public void setModuleMap(java.util.Map<Modules,ModuleBase> hashMap)
        sets the module map which contains name of Modules enum and ModuleBase model
        Parameters:
        Map -
        that contains enum Modules as key and ModuleBase object as its value

      • populateModuleMap

        private void populateModuleMap()
        This method populates the ModuleBase objects in the moduleMap object by reading the data from the JSON file.
